WorkItem.Description: Should we change default to enabled?

Comments.Message: I did have it defaulted to enabled for one version, and it confused the hell out of a TON of users. The number of "wtf this is broken is says item A is better than item B, which is obviously wrong" reports was staggering. I got tired of copying and pasting "Does A have a gem of a color that you need to satisfy your metagem requirement, and B doesn't, and you have Enforce Metagem Requirements enabled?" everywhere.

I like the current default.  I suspect optimization is smoother/faster when the requirement is disabled.

Perhaps you could add a visual indication for an unhappy metagem.  Maybe a stop-sign in place of the helm icon, along with a tooltip explaining the problem.
I can't find this setting. How do I enable it?
Added feature where head slot gets a red border if meta gem is disabled and enforce gem requirements is ticked.

So do you have to enforce all gem requirements in order to enforce the meta gem requirement? I don't mind forgoing most gem bonuses, but there's no point having a meta gem if you don't have the requirements. Can "Enforce Meta Gem Requirements" be separate option? If it already is, please tell me where it is.

"Can 'Enforce Meta Gem Requirements' be separate option? If it already is, please tell me where it is."

Under the "Stats" tab, just below "Race", there is a checkbox.
Should definitely be enables by default. there's no sense have a build that calculates your meta gem into  your stats, but doesn't gem your equipment to give you that bonus.
